variable.name: SUBJID
variable.description: Collection site ID (called SiteSubjID in phenotypic files) consisting of Site (not used for SGI collection, 2 digits for MGS1 collection, and 3 digits for MGS2 collection), Family (5 digits for SGI collection, and 4 digits for MGS1 or MGS2 collections) and Individual_within_family (5 digits for SGI collection, and 3 digits for MGS1 or MGS2 collections) with hyphens between the 2-3 elements for the cases and parents; OR consisting of Site (3 digits, always 150) and Individual (5 digits) with hyphens between the 2 elements for the controls

variable.name: SUBJ_SOURCE
variable.comment: All subject's samples are from RUCDR (Rutgers University Cell and DNA Repository)

variable.name: SOURCE_SUBJID
variable.description: Subject ID used in the Source Repository
variable.comment: Also known as DNA_ID, the ID number assigned by the RUCDR to this subject's DNA specimens

variable.name: SUBJ_SOURCE2
variable.description: Genotyping set (in this cases nonGAIN, as opposed to previous GAIN_EA and GAIN_AA done in the same collection study on different samples)

variable.name: SOURCE_SUBJID2
variable.description: NonGAIN ID, written as NG - 5 digit number when referring to samples (see sample subject mapping file)

variable.name: CONSENT
variable.description: Consent group as determined by DAC
variable.value: Schizophrenia and related conditions (also called SARC)
